trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert <xref href="System.Enum"></xref> objects to and from various other representations.
This converter can only convert an enumeration object to and from a string.

The <xref:System.ComponentModel.EnumConverter> class provides the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EnumConverter.Comparer%2A> property to get an <xref:System.Collections.IComparer> interface that can be used to sort the values of the enumeration.
By default, the enumeration values are sorted in the order they appear in the file.

For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
You should never create an instance of an <xref:System.ComponentModel.EnumConverter>.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.EnumConverter"></xref> class for the given type.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type of enumeration to associate with this enumeration converter.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object in the given source type to an enumeration object using the specified context.
This converter can only convert an enumeration object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type you wish to convert from.
`true` if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type you wish to convert to.
`true` if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> that can be used to sort the values of the enumeration.
By default, the enumeration values are sorted in the order they appear in the file.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IComparer"></xref> for sorting the enumeration values.
Converts the specified value object to an enumeration object.
This converter can only convert an enumeration object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An optional <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref>.
If not supplied, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
An that represents the converted value.
value is not a valid value for the target type.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Converts the given value object to the specified destination type.
This converter can only convert an enumeration object to and from a string.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
The behavior of the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EnumConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method is undefined if the enumeration has multiple fields with the same value.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
An optional <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref>.
If not supplied, the current culture is assumed.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to convert.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> to convert the value to.
An that represents the converted value.
destinationType is `null`.
value is not a valid value for the enumeration.
The conversion cannot be performed.
Specifies the type of the enumerator this converter is associated with.
The type of the enumerator this converter is associated with.
Gets a collection of standard values for the data type this validator is designed for.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
Any fields of the enumeration that are marked with <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> set to `false` will not be returned.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> that holds a standard set of valid values, or `null` if the data type does not support a standard set of values.
Gets a value indicating whether the list of standard values returned from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> is an exclusive list using the specified context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.

`true` if the <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> returned from <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> is an exhaustive list of possible values; `false` if other values are possible.
Gets a value indicating whether this object supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list using the specified context.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
`true` because <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.GetStandardValues"></xref> should be called to find a common set of values the object supports.
This method never returns `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the given object value is valid for this type.
The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from.
This can be `null`, so always check.
Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides a format context.
The <xref href="System.Object"></xref> to test.
`true` if the specified value is valid for this object; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> that specifies the possible values for the enumeration.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> that specifies the possible values for the enumeration.
